description: The length of time the customer has been with the company, as long-term customers are less likely to churn
The amount the customer is charged per month, as higher charges may lead to more churn
The number of customer support calls made by the customer, as more calls may indicate dissatisfaction
The type of contract the customer has (e.g., monthly, yearly), as this can affect their likelihood of churning
The type of internet service the customer has (e.g., DSL, fiber optic), as different types may impact churn differently
Whether the customer subscribes to streaming services, as this may affect their satisfaction and likelihood of churning
The method of payment used by the customer, as this may be correlated with churn
The satisfaction score reported by the customer, as lower scores may indicate higher likelihood of churn
The frequency of service outages experienced by the customer, as this can impact their satisfaction and likelihood of churning
The total amount of refunds issued to the customer, as this may indicate dissatisfaction with the service
Whether the company sends contract renewal reminders to the customer, as this may impact customer retention
Whether the customer has received a competitive offer from another company, which may influence their decision to churn
The income level of the customer's household, as this may impact their ability to afford the service
The age of the customer, as older or younger customers may have different churn behavior
Whether the customer has children, as this may impact their priorities and likelihood of churning
The usage of additional features provided by the company, such as cloud storage or security services, which may impact satisfaction and churn
The frequency and type of interactions the customer has with the company's website, as this may indicate engagement and likelihood of churn
The level of engagement with the company on social media platforms, as this may indicate satisfaction and likelihood of churn
Whether the customer has accepted all the terms and conditions of the contract, as this may impact their commitment to the service
The number of people in the customer's household, as larger households may have different churn behavior compared to smaller ones
The geographic location of the customer, as regional factors may impact churn rates
The availability of competing services in the customer's area, as this may influence their likelihood of churning
The number of customer engagement events attended, as this may indicate loyalty and likelihood of churn
The number of recent complaints filed by the customer, as this may indicate dissatisfaction and likelihood of churn
The average time taken to resolve billing issues for the customer, as prompt resolution may impact satisfaction and churn
Whether the customer has participated in the company's referral program, as this may indicate loyalty and likelihood of churn
The predicted net profit attributed to the entire future relationship with a customer, as higher value customers may be less likely to churn
The frequency and extent of product usage by the customer, as this may indicate satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The sentiment analysis of customer feedback, as negative sentiment may indicate higher likelihood of churn
The customer's experience with downtime or service interruptions, as this may impact their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The customer's preferred communication channel (e.g., email, phone, chat), as this may impact their engagement and likelihood of churn
Variations in customer usage based on seasonal patterns, as this may impact their likelihood of churning at different times of the year
The emotional state of the customer, as this may impact their decision-making and likelihood of churn
The health of the customer's account based on various usage and engagement metrics, as this may indicate their likelihood of churning
A score representing the level of trust the customer has in the company, as this may impact their likelihood of churning
Occurrence of significant life events for the customer (e.g., marriage, relocation), as this may influence their priorities and likelihood of churning
The customer's preference for specific product features, as this may impact their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The customer's investment in learning and training related to the product or service, as this may indicate their commitment and likelihood of churn
The influence of the customer's social circle on their decisions, as this may impact their likelihood of churning
The customer's attitude towards technology and digital services, as this may influence their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The customer's response to promotional offers and discounts, as this may indicate their loyalty and likelihood of churn
The customer's awareness of alternative products or services in the market, as this may influence their likelihood of churning
The customer's receptiveness to feedback and suggestions, as this may impact their loyalty and likelihood of churn
The customer's preferences for customer service interactions (e.g., chat, phone), as this may impact their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The strength and quality of the customer's relationship with their account manager, as this may influence their likelihood of churning
The customer's sentiment towards any mergers or acquisitions involving the company, as this may impact their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The customer's involvement in community events or initiatives organized by the company, as this may indicate loyalty and likelihood of churn
The customer's adoption of new features or updates to the product or service, as this may impact their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The customer's orientation towards sustainability and eco-friendly practices, as this may influence their loyalty and likelihood of churn
The alignment of the customer's expectations with the actual service provided, as a mismatch may impact their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The availability of the customer for providing feedback to the company, as this may indicate their engagement and likelihood of churn
Changes in the customer's habits and routines, as this may influence their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The customer's contribution to community discussions and forums related to the company's products or services, as this may indicate their loyalty and engagement
The customer's sensitivity to changes in pricing or subscription fees, as this may impact their likelihood of churn
The quality of the customer's relationship with customer service representatives, as this may influence their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The customer's willingness to participate in surveys and feedback requests, as this may indicate their engagement and likelihood of churn
The customer's experience with self-service options provided by the company, as this may impact their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The ease of access to account information and billing details for the customer, as this may influence their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
The customer's hesitancy or reluctance to renew their contract or subscription, as this may indicate their likelihood of churn
The customer's adoption of flexible payment options offered by the company, as this may impact their satisfaction and likelihood of churn
